main.name: main
main.desc: When defined, this function automatically runs when the XS file is included in an RMS. This function should never be declared with any arguments!

params.name: ruleName
params.desc: The name of the rule to disable

xsDisableSelf.name: xsDisableSelf
xsDisableSelf.desc: Disables the rule this function is called inside. Cannot be used outside of a rule's body!

params.name: ruleName
params.desc: The name of the rule to enable

xsIsRuleEnabled.name: xsIsRuleEnabled

params.name: ruleName
params.desc: The name of the rule to check

xsIsRuleEnabled.desc: Returns true if the rule is enabled, else returns false.

xsSetRulePriority.name: xsSetRulePriority

params.name: ruleName
params.desc: The name of the rule to set the priority of

params.name: priority
params.desc: The new priority of the rule

xsSetRulePriority.desc: Sets the priority of the given rule.

xsSetRulePrioritySelf.name: xsSetRulePrioritySelf

params.name: priority
params.desc: The new priority of the rule

xsSetRulePrioritySelf.desc: Sets the priority of the rule this function is called inside. Cannot be used outside of a rule's body!

xsSetRuleMinInterval.name: xsSetRuleMinInterval

params.name: ruleName
params.desc: The name of the rule to set the min interval of

params.name: interval
params.desc: The new min interval of the rule

xsSetRuleMinInterval.desc: Sets the min interval of the given rule.

xsSetRuleMinIntervalSelf.name: xsSetRuleMinIntervalSelf

params.name: interval
params.desc: The new min interval of the rule

xsSetRuleMinIntervalSelf.desc: Sets the min interval of the rule this function is called inside. Cannot be used outside of a rule's body!

xsSetRuleMaxInterval.name: xsSetRuleMaxInterval

params.name: ruleName
params.desc: The name of the rule to set the max interval of

params.name: interval
params.desc: The new max interval of the rule

xsSetRuleMaxInterval.desc: Sets the max interval of the given rule.

xsSetRuleMaxIntervalSelf.name: xsSetRuleMaxIntervalSelf

params.name: interval
params.desc: The new max interval of the rule

xsSetRuleMaxIntervalSelf.desc: Sets the max interval of the rule this function is called inside. Cannot be used outside of a rule's body!

xsEnableRuleGroup.name: xsEnableRuleGroup

params.name: ruleGroupName
params.desc: The name of the rule group to enable

xsEnableRuleGroup.desc: Enables all the rules in the given rule group

xsDisableRuleGroup.name: xsDisableRuleGroup

params.name: ruleGroupName
params.desc: The name of the rule group to disable

xsDisableRuleGroup.desc: Disables all the rules in the given rule group

xsIsRuleGroupEnabled.name: xsIsRuleGroupEnabled

params.name: ruleGroupName
params.desc: The name of the rule group to check

xsIsRuleGroupEnabled.desc: Returns true, if all the rules in the given rule group are enabled

xsVectorGetX.name: xsVectorGetX

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to get the X coordinate of

xsVectorGetX.desc: The X coordinate of the vector given.

xsVectorGetY.name: xsVectorGetY

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to get the Y coordinate of

xsVectorGetY.desc: The Y coordinate of the vector given.

xsVectorGetZ.name: xsVectorGetZ

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to get the Z coordinate of

xsVectorGetZ.desc: The Z coordinate of the vector given.

xsVectorSetX.name: xsVectorSetX

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to modify the X coordinate of

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to set the X coordinate to

xsVectorSetX.desc: Returns a new vector with the X component of the given vector changed to the given value. Note: This function DOES NOT modify the vector given as the parameter!

xsVectorSetY.name: xsVectorSetY

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to modify the Y coordinate of

params.name: y
params.desc: The value to set the Y coordinate to

xsVectorSetY.desc: Returns a new vector with the Y component of the given vector changed to the given value. Note: This function DOES NOT modify the vector given as the parameter!

xsVectorSetZ.name: xsVectorSetZ

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to modify the Z coordinate of

params.name: z
params.desc: The value to set the Z coordinate to

xsVectorSetZ.desc: Returns a new vector with the Z component of the given vector changed to the given value. Note: This function DOES NOT modify the vector given as the parameter!

xsVectorSet.name: xsVectorSet

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to set the X coordinate to

params.name: y
params.desc: The value to set the Y coordinate to

params.name: z
params.desc: The value to set the Z coordinate to

xsVectorSet.desc: Returns a vector with the given X, Y and Z components.

xsVectorLength.name: xsVectorLength

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to calculate the length of

xsVectorLength.desc: Returns the length of the given vector.

xsVectorNormalize.name: xsVectorNormalize

params.name: v
params.desc: The vector to normalise

xsVectorNormalize.desc: Returns the normalised vector in the direction of the given vector.

abs.name: abs

params.name: x
params.desc: The number to find the absolute value of

abs.desc: Returns the absolute value (magnitude) of the given number.

sqrt.name: sqrt

params.name: x
params.desc: The number to find the square root of

sqrt.desc: Returns the square root of the given number.

pow.name: pow

params.name: x
params.desc: The base value

params.name: y
params.desc: The exponenet to raise the base value to

pow.desc: Returns x raised to the power y (x**y).

sin.name: sin

params.name: x
params.desc: The angle (in radians) to find the sine of

sin.desc: Returns the sine of the angle in radians.

cos.name: cos

params.name: x
params.desc: The angle (in radians) to find the cosine of

cos.desc: Returns the cosine of the angle in radians

tan.name: tan

params.name: x
params.desc: The angle (in radians) to find the tangent of

tan.desc: Returns the tangent of the angle in radians

asin.name: asin

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to find the inverse sine of

asin.desc: Returns the inverse sine (arcsin) of the given value

acos.name: acos

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to find the inverse cosine of

acos.desc: Returns the inverse cosine (arccos) of the given value

atan.name: atan

params.name: x
params.desc: The value to find the inverse tangent of

atan.desc: Returns the inverse tangent (arctan) of the given value

atan2.name: atan2

params.name: x
params.desc: The X coordinate of the point to find the amplitude of

atan2.desc: This is supposed to be the atan2(y, x) function but apparently it only takes one input. ThxDE

xsPlayerAttribute.name: xsPlayerAttribute

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to get the resource of (0 for Gaia)

params.name: resourceID
params.desc: The ID of the resource to get the amount of

xsPlayerAttribute.desc: Returns the amount the specified resource of the given player.

xsSetPlayerAttribute.name: xsSetPlayerAttribute

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to set the resource of (0 for Gaia)

params.name: resourceID
params.desc: The ID of the resource to set the amount of

params.name: value
params.desc: The amount to set the resource to

xsSetPlayerAttribute.desc: Sets the amount of the specified resource of the given player to the provided value.

xsTriggerVariable.name: xsTriggerVariable

params.name: variableID
params.desc: The ID of the variable to get the value of

xsTriggerVariable.desc: Returns the value of the variable of the given variable ID.

xsSetTriggerVariable.name: xsSetTriggerVariable

params.name: variableID
params.desc: The ID of the variable to set the value of

params.name: value
params.desc: The value to set the variable to

xsSetTriggerVariable.desc: Sets the value of the variable of the given variable ID to the provided value.

xsGetNumPlayers.name: xsGetNumPlayers
xsGetNumPlayers.desc: Returns the number of players in the game

xsChatData.name: xsChatData

params.name: message
params.desc: The message to display in chat

params.name: value
params.desc: This value is inserted in place of any `%d` used in the message of the function

xsChatData.desc: Shows the given message in the game chat

xsGetTime.name: xsGetTime
xsGetTime.desc: Returns the current game time in seconds

xsEffectAmount.name: xsEffectAmount

params.name: effectID
params.desc: The ID of the effect to use

params.name: unitOrTechnologyID
params.desc: The ID of the unit or technology to effect

params.name: attribtueOrOperation
params.desc: The attribute to modify or the operation to perform

params.name: value
params.desc: The value of the effect

params.name: playerNumber
params.desc: The player to apply the effect to. If unspecified, applies to all players except Gaia.

xsEffectAmount.desc: Change the given attribute of the specified unit or technology by the value for the provided player.

xsDumpArrays.name: xsDumpArrays
xsDumpArrays.desc: Blogs out all XS arrays. Unknown: where does it dump this information?

xsGetContextPlayer.name: xsGetContextPlayer
xsGetContextPlayer.desc: Returns the current context player ID. Unknown: Unused feature?

xsSetContextPlayer.name: xsSetContextPlayer

params.name: playerID
params.desc: The player ID for the new context player

xsSetContextPlayer.desc: Sets the current context player ID. Used to retrieve more detailed information about the new player. Unknown: Unused Feature?

xsGetFuntionID.name: xsGetFuntionID

params.name: functionName
params.desc: The name of the function to get the internal ID of

xsGetFuntionID.desc: Returns the ID of the given function name. If the function does not exist, returns -1. Unknown: What can this be used for?

xsBreakPoint.name: xsBreakPoint
xsBreakPoint.desc: Crashes the game... ThxDE. Unknown: Why can an XS function crash your game? Just why
